newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenian shares firm, gains seen short-lived.
newsitem.headline: Slovenian shares firm, gains seen short-lived.

text.p: Slovenia's blue-chip SBI index firmed 0.59 percent on Friday to end the week 2.6 percent higher but traders forecast a downward correction in the coming two weeks.
"I expect the correction could push the index down to 1,440 or 1,450 points," one trader said.
The SBI index rose 8.74 points to 1,478.21.
Overall ten shares rose, five fell, two were unchanged and 11 were untraded.
Issue A of drug firm Lek had the highest turnover, keeping steady at 34,600 tolars on volume of 8,230 shares for a total turnover of 286.3 million tolars.
Lek's issue C was the biggest gainer, up 4.33 percent to 33,490 tolars on volume of 138 shares.
Ordinary shares of trader Kovinotehna led decliners, falling 4.81 percent to 475 tolars on volume of 1,166 shares in what traders said was a technical correction to recent gains.
Analysts said drug maker Krka, petrol traders Petrol and Istrabenz and trader Mercator would probably prove to be the best performers in the short-term.
They pointed to good business results, relatively low share prices and a lot of international investor interest.
Of the four only Mercator ended in positive territory. It firmed 1.5 percent to 5,390 on volume of 5,117 shares.
